description: How to pay a DVSA fine or fixed penalty for vehicle defects, breaking the rules around exceeding drivers’ hours, and other offences.

details.introductory_paragraph:
Use this service to pay:

  • fixed penalties for vehicle defects and other offences such as breaking the rules around drivers’ hours
  • immobilisation fees
  • court deposits

The Driver and Vehicle Standards Agency (DVSA) will send you an email and text message telling you the payment code, how much to pay and by when.

If you do not pay your fine on time your lorry, bus or coach could be immobilised, you might have to pay more, or you could be taken to court.

This page is also available in 23 other languages.
details.more_information:
You will need:

  • your payment code
  • a credit or debit card

Other ways to pay

By phone

DVSA customer service centre
Telephone: +44 (0)300 123 9000
Monday to Friday, 7:30am to 6pm
Find out about call charges

You will need one of the following:

  • your payment code
  • your fine reference number from a fixed penalty notice
  • the vehicle registration number (number plate)

By post (UK drivers or operators only)

Pay by cheque or postal order. Make it payable to ‘DVSA Fixed Penalties Office’ and write your payment code on the back.

DVSA Fixed Penalties Office
Ellipse
Padley Road
Swansea
SA1 8AN

In person

You can pay cash to the DVSA examiner when they give you the fine.
